title: Tender and Easy Buttermilk Waffles Recipe
description: These buttermilk waffles are crisp on the outside and tender in the middle. They're easy to make and perfect for a family-pleasing weekend breakfast!
body: ‚Äã Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Waffle Recipes Tender and Easy Buttermilk Waffles 4.7 (504) 391 Reviews 94 Photos These buttermilk waffles are crisp on the outside and tender in the middle. I love the results this gives while not having to separate the eggs and take time to whip egg whites! These will also reheat in the toaster for a quick workday breakfast. Submitted by Diana Perry Updated on March 15, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 94 94 94 94 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 cups all-purpose flour 2 tablespoons white sugar 2 teaspoons baking powder 1 teaspoon baking soda ¬Ω teaspoon salt 2 cups low-fat buttermilk ‚Öì cup melted butter 2 large eggs, lightly beaten 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a bowl until evenly combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk buttermilk and melted butter together in a separate bowl; whisk in eggs. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir buttermilk mixture into flour mixture until just combined and batter is slightly lumpy; stir in vanilla extract. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Preheat a waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions. To cook each waffle, pour enough batter into the preheated waffle iron to reach 1/2 inch from the edge. Cook according to manufacturer's instructions. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Recipe Tip To keep the waffles warm, preheat the oven to about 250 to 275 degrees F (120 to 135 degrees C). Place the cooked waffles on a wire rack on top of a baking sheet, and keep them in the oven as you make the whole batch. I Made It Print 1,303 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 318 Calories 13g Fat 41g Carbs 9g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 318 % Daily Value * Total Fat 13g 17% Saturated Fat 8g 38% Cholesterol 92mg 31% Sodium 749mg 33% Total Carbohydrate 41g 15% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 8g Protein 9g 18% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 203mg 16% Iron 3mg 14% Potassium 195mg 4% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Tender and Easy Buttermilk Waffles 01 of 94 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 94 Photo by¬† Catherine 11/17/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow 03 of 94 Photo by¬† Jai Sheha 08/13/2024 A keeper! To make a smaller batch just cut recipe in half. 04 of 94 Photo by¬† MaeveRaven 02/04/2024 I don‚Äôt usually keep buttermilk on hand, but I almost always have sour cream or plain Greek yogurt. I subbed 1/3 cup plain Greek yogurt and 2/3 cup milk for each cup of buttermilk. (My usual go-to substitution.) I also used 1/2 whole wheat and half white AP flour. The waffles were fluffy and tasty. Hubby says this one is a keeper. 05 of 94 Photo by¬† fabeveryday 12/03/2023 These were perfect exactly as written! My kids said it should be our go-to waffles recipe. In the future I might experiment with adding a little cinnamon to the mix, but it really is perfect as written. 06 of 94 Photo by¬† tasha1011 03/31/2023 Made these this morning they came out so yummy I made a mango and blueberry topping for them‚Ä¶so delicious üíú 07 of 94 Photo by¬† Tammi 07/02/2022 Best waffle recipe I have tried! I did add some strawberry yogurt and chopped up strawberries because I was making it for my mother. They are awesome, perfect! 08 of 94 Photo by¬† kathryn6 03/08/2022 This is our go-to waffle recipe! I now make it from memory, and I thought I was following the recipe exactly, but I just realized that I actually double the vanilla when I make it :) It's delicious with doubled vanilla, haha! I also like to let the batter rest maybe 2-3 minutes after everything is mixed before I cook the waffles sometimes. 09 of 94 Photo by¬† Charles Chrismon Junior 02/26/2022 Made the recipe as is, and it was absolutely heavenly! Best waffles üßá I have ever eaten! Page bookmarked, as new go to breakfast!Thank you sooo much for sharing! üëç 10 of 94 Photo by¬† MOCKTURTLE 08/30/2021 Truly tasty and easy waffles! I just made them following the recipe without variation. They were golden and tender, and the flavor was perfect. Though I generally prefer to eat waffles after pouring a bit of maple syrup in each hollow, the little crispy bits in between the waffles were scrumptious all on their own. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Buttermilk Waffles 36 Ratings Eggnog Waffles 8 Ratings Bacon-Topped Savory Waffles with Onion Sauce 5 Ratings Waffles 5,385 Ratings Protein Waffles 67 Ratings Easy French Toast Waffles 97 Ratings Homemade Waffles 14 Ratings Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookie Waffles 3 Ratings Waffle Iron Cornbread 20 Ratings Savory Southwestern Waffles 4 Ratings Green Waffles 2 Ratings Coconut Chocolate Chip Waffles 12 Ratings Gluten-Free Waffles 37 Ratings Whole Grain Waffles 892 Ratings Chaffles with Almond Flour 51 Ratings Chaffles 14 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family. name: Diana Perry
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a bowl until evenly combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Whisk buttermilk and melted butter together in a separate bowl; whisk in eggs. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Stir buttermilk mixture into flour mixture until just combined and batter is slightly lumpy; stir in vanilla extract. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Preheat a waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions.;To cook each waffle, pour enough batter into the preheated waffle iron to reach 1/2 inch from the edge.
